name: _complete
description: Internal command to provide shell completion suggestions

options.name: shell
options.description: The shell type ("bash", "fish", "zsh")

options.name: input
options.description: An array of input tokens (e.g. COMP_WORDS or argv)

options.name: current
options.description: The index of the "input" array that the cursor is in (e.g. COMP_CWORD)

options.name: api-version
options.description: The API version of the completion script

options.name: symfony
options.description: deprecated

name: about
description: Display basic information about your application

options.name: only
options.description: The section to display

options.name: json
options.description: Output the information as JSON

name: auth:clear-resets
description: Flush expired password reset tokens

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the password broker

name: cache:clear
description: Flush the application cache

arguments.name: store
arguments.description: The name of the store you would like to clear

options.name: tags
options.description: The cache tags you would like to clear

name: cache:forget
description: Remove an item from the cache

arguments.name: store
arguments.description: The store to remove the key from

name: cache:prune-stale-tags
description: Prune stale cache tags from the cache (Redis only)

arguments.name: store
arguments.description: The name of the store you would like to prune tags from

name: channel:list
description: List all registered private broadcast channels

name: clear-compiled
description: Remove the compiled class file

name: completion
description: Dump the shell completion script

arguments.name: shell
arguments.description: The shell type (e.g. "bash"), the value of the "$SHELL" env var will be used if this is not given

options.name: debug
options.description: Tail the completion debug log

name: config:cache
description: Create a cache file for faster configuration loading

name: config:clear
description: Remove the configuration cache file

name: config:publish
description: Publish configuration files to your application

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the configuration file to publish

options.name: all
options.description: Publish all configuration files

options.name: force
options.description: Overwrite any existing configuration files

name: config:show
description: Display all of the values for a given configuration file or key

arguments.name: config
arguments.description: The configuration file or key to show

name: db
description: Start a new database CLI session

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: The database connection that should be used

options.name: read
options.description: Connect to the read connection

options.name: write
options.description: Connect to the write connection

name: db:monitor
description: Monitor the number of connections on the specified database

options.name: databases
options.description: The database connections to monitor

options.name: max
options.description: The maximum number of connections that can be open before an event is dispatched

description: Seed the database with records

arguments.description: The class name of the root seeder

options.name: class
options.description: The class name of the root seeder

options.name: database
options.description: The database connection to seed

options.name: force
options.description: Force the operation to run when in production

name: db:show
description: Display information about the given database

options.name: database
options.description: The database connection

options.name: json
options.description: Output the database information as JSON

options.name: counts
options.description: Show the table row count <bg=red;options=bold> Note: This can be slow on large databases </>

options.name: views
options.description: Show the database views <bg=red;options=bold> Note: This can be slow on large databases </>

options.name: types
options.description: Show the user defined types

name: db:table
description: Display information about the given database table

options.name: database
options.description: The database connection

options.name: json
options.description: Output the table information as JSON

name: db:wipe
description: Drop all tables, views, and types

options.name: database
options.description: The database connection to use

options.name: drop-views
options.description: Drop all tables and views

options.name: drop-types
options.description: Drop all tables and types (Postgres only)

options.name: force
options.description: Force the operation to run when in production

name: docs
description: Access the Laravel documentation

arguments.name: section
arguments.description: The section of the page to open

name: down
description: Put the application into maintenance / demo mode

options.name: redirect
options.description: The path that users should be redirected to

options.name: render
options.description: The view that should be prerendered for display during maintenance mode

options.name: retry
options.description: The number of seconds after which the request may be retried

options.name: refresh
options.description: The number of seconds after which the browser may refresh

options.name: secret
options.description: The secret phrase that may be used to bypass maintenance mode

options.name: with-secret
options.description: Generate a random secret phrase that may be used to bypass maintenance mode

options.name: status
options.description: The status code that should be used when returning the maintenance mode response

name: env
description: Display the current framework environment

description: Decrypt an environment file

options.name: key
options.description: The encryption key

options.name: cipher
options.description: The encryption cipher

options.name: env
options.description: The environment to be decrypted

options.name: force
options.description: Overwrite the existing environment file

options.name: path
options.description: Path to write the decrypted file

options.name: filename
options.description: Filename of the decrypted file

name: env:encrypt
description: Encrypt an environment file

options.name: key
options.description: The encryption key

options.name: cipher
options.description: The encryption cipher

options.name: env
options.description: The environment to be encrypted

options.name: prune
options.description: Delete the original environment file

options.name: force
options.description: Overwrite the existing encrypted environment file

name: event:cache
description: Discover and cache the application's events and listeners

options.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

options.name: raw
options.description: To output raw command help

name: inspire
description: Display an inspiring quote

options.description: Absolute path to the Composer binary which should be used to install packages

options.description: Overwrite any existing API routes file

options.description: Install Laravel Passport instead of Laravel Sanctum

options.name: without-migration-prompt
options.description: Do not prompt to run pending migrations

options.description: Overwrite any existing broadcasting routes file

options.name: without-reverb

options.description: Install Laravel Reverb as the default broadcaster

options.name: pusher
options.description: Install Pusher as the default broadcaster

options.name: ably
options.description: Install Ably as the default broadcaster

options.name: without-node
options.description: Do not prompt to install Node dependencies

name: invoke-serialized-closure
description: Invoke the given serialized closure

description: Set the application key

options.name: show
options.description: Display the key instead of modifying files

options.name: force
options.description: Force the operation to run when in production

options.description: Publish and overwrite only the files that have already been published

options.name: short

name: migrate
description: Run the database migrations

options.name: database
options.description: The database connection to use

options.name: force
options.description: Force the operation to run when in production

options.name: path
options.description: The path(s) to the migrations files to be executed

options.name: realpath
options.description: Indicate any provided migration file paths are pre-resolved absolute paths

options.name: schema-path
options.description: The path to a schema dump file

options.name: pretend
options.description: Dump the SQL queries that would be run

options.name: seed
options.description: Indicates if the seed task should be re-run

options.name: seeder
options.description: The class name of the root seeder

options.name: step
options.description: Force the migrations to be run so they can be rolled back individually

options.name: graceful
options.description: Return a successful exit code even if an error occurs

options.name: isolated
options.description: Do not run the command if another instance of the command is already running

name: queue:clear
description: Delete all of the jobs from the specified queue

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: The name of the queue connection to clear

options.name: queue
options.description: The name of the queue to clear

options.name: force
options.description: Force the operation to run when in production

name: queue:failed
description: List all of the failed queue jobs

name: queue:flush
description: Flush all of the failed queue jobs

options.name: hours
options.description: The number of hours to retain failed job data

name: queue:forget
description: Delete a failed queue job

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The ID of the failed job

name: queue:listen
description: Listen to a given queue

options.name: name
options.description: The name of the worker

options.name: delay
options.description: The number of seconds to delay failed jobs (Deprecated)

options.name: backoff
options.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying a job that encountered an uncaught exception

options.name: force
options.description: Force the worker to run even in maintenance mode

options.name: memory
options.description: The memory limit in megabytes

options.name: queue
options.description: The queue to listen on

options.name: sleep
options.description: Number of seconds to sleep when no job is available

options.name: rest
options.description: Number of seconds to rest between jobs

options.name: timeout
options.description: The number of seconds a child process can run

options.name: tries
options.description: Number of times to attempt a job before logging it failed

name: queue:monitor
description: Monitor the size of the specified queues

arguments.name: queues
arguments.description: The names of the queues to monitor

options.name: max
options.description: The maximum number of jobs that can be on the queue before an event is dispatched

options.name: json
options.description: Output the queue size as JSON

name: queue:prune-batches
description: Prune stale entries from the batches database

options.name: hours
options.description: The number of hours to retain batch data

options.name: unfinished
options.description: The number of hours to retain unfinished batch data

options.name: cancelled
options.description: The number of hours to retain cancelled batch data

name: queue:prune-failed
description: Prune stale entries from the failed jobs table

options.name: hours
options.description: The number of hours to retain failed jobs data

name: queue:restart
description: Restart queue worker daemons after their current job

name: queue:retry
description: Retry a failed queue job

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The ID of the failed job or "all" to retry all jobs

options.name: queue
options.description: Retry all of the failed jobs for the specified queue

options.name: range
options.description: Range of job IDs (numeric) to be retried (e.g. 1-5)

name: queue:retry-batch
description: Retry the failed jobs for a batch

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The ID of the batch whose failed jobs should be retried

options.name: isolated
options.description: Do not run the command if another instance of the command is already running

name: queue:work
description: Start processing jobs on the queue as a daemon

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: The name of the queue connection to work

options.name: name
options.description: The name of the worker

options.name: queue
options.description: The names of the queues to work

options.name: daemon
options.description: Run the worker in daemon mode (Deprecated)

options.name: once
options.description: Only process the next job on the queue

options.name: stop-when-empty
options.description: Stop when the queue is empty

options.name: delay
options.description: The number of seconds to delay failed jobs (Deprecated)

options.name: backoff
options.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying a job that encountered an uncaught exception

options.name: max-jobs
options.description: The number of jobs to process before stopping

options.name: max-time
options.description: The maximum number of seconds the worker should run

options.name: force
options.description: Force the worker to run even in maintenance mode

options.name: memory
options.description: The memory limit in megabytes

options.name: sleep
options.description: Number of seconds to sleep when no job is available

options.name: rest
options.description: Number of seconds to rest between jobs

options.name: timeout
options.description: The number of seconds a child process can run

options.name: tries
options.description: Number of times to attempt a job before logging it failed

options.name: json
options.description: Output the queue worker information as JSON

name: route:cache
description: Create a route cache file for faster route registration

name: route:clear
description: Remove the route cache file

name: route:list
description: List all registered routes

options.name: json
options.description: Output the route list as JSON

options.name: method
options.description: Filter the routes by method

options.name: action
options.description: Filter the routes by action

options.name: name
options.description: Filter the routes by name

options.name: domain
options.description: Filter the routes by domain

options.name: path
options.description: Only show routes matching the given path pattern

options.name: except-path
options.description: Do not display the routes matching the given path pattern

options.name: reverse
options.description: Reverse the ordering of the routes

options.name: sort
options.description: The column (domain, method, uri, name, action, middleware, definition) to sort by

options.name: except-vendor
options.description: Do not display routes defined by vendor packages

options.name: only-vendor
options.description: Only display routes defined by vendor packages

name: sail:add
description: Add a service to an existing Sail installation

arguments.name: services
arguments.description: The services that should be added

name: sail:install
description: Install Laravel Sail's default Docker Compose file

options.name: with
options.description: The services that should be included in the installation

options.name: devcontainer
options.description: Create a .devcontainer configuration directory

options.name: php
options.description: The PHP version that should be used

name: sail:publish
description: Publish the Laravel Sail Docker files

name: schedule:clear-cache
description: Delete the cached mutex files created by scheduler

name: schedule:finish
description: Handle the completion of a scheduled command

name: schedule:interrupt
description: Interrupt the current schedule run

name: schedule:list
description: List all scheduled tasks

options.name: timezone
options.description: The timezone that times should be displayed in

options.name: next
options.description: Sort the listed tasks by their next due date

name: schedule:run
description: Run the scheduled commands

options.name: whisper
options.description: Do not output message indicating that no jobs were ready to run

name: schedule:test
description: Run a scheduled command

options.name: name
options.description: The name of the scheduled command to run

name: schedule:work
description: Start the schedule worker

options.name: run-output-file
options.description: The file to direct <info>schedule:run</info> output to

name: schema:dump
description: Dump the given database schema

options.name: database
options.description: The database connection to use

options.name: path
options.description: The path where the schema dump file should be stored

options.name: prune
options.description: Delete all existing migration files

name: serve
description: Serve the application on the PHP development server

options.name: host
options.description: The host address to serve the application on

options.name: port
options.description: The port to serve the application on

options.name: tries
options.description: The max number of ports to attempt to serve from

options.name: no-reload
options.description: Do not reload the development server on .env file changes

name: storage:link
description: Create the symbolic links configured for the application

options.name: relative
options.description: Create the symbolic link using relative paths

options.name: force
options.description: Recreate existing symbolic links

name: storage:unlink
description: Delete existing symbolic links configured for the application

name: stub:publish
description: Publish all stubs that are available for customization

options.name: existing
options.description: Publish and overwrite only the files that have already been published

options.name: force
options.description: Overwrite any existing files

name: test

options.name: without-tty
options.description: Disable output to TTY

options.name: compact
options.description: Indicates whether the compact printer should be used

options.name: coverage
options.description: Indicates whether code coverage information should be collected

options.name: min
options.description: Indicates the minimum threshold enforcement for code coverage

options.name: parallel
options.description: Indicates if the tests should run in parallel

options.name: profile
options.description: Lists top 10 slowest tests

options.name: recreate-databases
options.description: Indicates if the test databases should be re-created

options.name: drop-databases
options.description: Indicates if the test databases should be dropped

options.name: without-databases
options.description: Indicates if database configuration should be performed

name: tinker
description: Interact with your application

options.name: execute
options.description: Execute the given code using Tinker

name: up
description: Bring the application out of maintenance mode

options.description: Overwrite any existing files
